neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill one of Boston's most picturesque area, tony Beacon Hill has steep streets lined with Federal-stye and Victorian brick row house lit by antique lanterns.  The gold-domed Massachusetts State House overlooks Boston Common, with its winter skating pond.  Across Charles Street home to chic boutiques and antiques shops, in the formal Public Garden.  The Charles River Esplanade's Hatch Shell hosts summer concerts
notes: Please DO NOT smoke in or around the property.  Please no pets and no parties.  PLEASE DO NOT LEAVE THE TRASH OUTSIDE. Trash are picked up Mondays and Fridays.  Please leave the trash at the curb on the street, between midnight to 7am or contact me if trash needs to be removed during your stay.  Please be mindful to our neighbors in the building. Please be quiet after hours after 10pm.  THERE WILL BE A $100 FINE IF  KEYS ARE LOST
transit: I recommend relying on public transportation (MTBA).  Stations on the train system: Park, Haymarket, Charles/MGH, Gov't Center. T stops are all within walking distance which allows easy access to Logan International Airport and the rest of the Greater Boston Area.  Also recommend Uber/Lyft.   Apps: BostonMap, ParkBoston, MBTA or Moovit to get detailed step by step direction.  View detailed routes on a map, see bus and train schedules, arrival times.
access: Self check-in: there is a locked key box below the window on the sidewalk and the left side of the doorway.  No additional guests are allowed on the premise unless they are on the itinerary or permission has been granted by the host Self check-out:  Please put keys back Master Lockbox and keep the trash inside the Studio (the host will take care of the trash)
interaction: I want my guests to enjoy their privacy, but I am available when needed.  No matter how long, or short the guest stay is, I will send a text message just to check to make sure guest are comfortable and everything is meeting expectations.  I am available to fix anything to have the guest's stay more pleasant, they would just need to send a text message or call me.

name: Cute Room in Beacon Hill/MIT/MGH | Walk Everywhere
summary: The house is a simple, historical 19th century home, situated in Boston's best neighborhood, Beacon Hill. Unbeatable location with easy access to every tourist spot. You will be sharing the house with potentially two other guests. Decent size of space with everything you need for a good sleep. Please note that this is my room I rent out while I am away, so you will see my personal belongings in the room and the closet. The room is on the forth(top) floor with no elevator and narrow stairs.
space: Location: You can't find a better location! The room is centrally located with easy access to public transportation, shared bikes, and tourists sites. Red Line (Charles/MGH): 7 mins walk Blue Line (Bowdoin): 5 mins walk Orange Line: 8 mins walk  Shared Hubway bikes: 1 min walk MGH: 5 min walk North End (Little Italy for Seafood): 15 mins walk TD Garden: 10 mins walk Boston Common: 9 mins walk Whole Foods (supermarket)/CVS/BoA(Bank): 30 seconds walk Newbury Street (shopping and restaurants): 16 mins walk Harvard Square: 17 mins by subway(red line) Fenway Park: 25 mins by subway, 10 mins by car Apartment:  The house has two floors (3rd and 4th/top floor) with 3 bedrooms and 1 shared bathroom. There's no in-unit washer, but the laundromat is only 5 mins walk away. There are also two dry-cleaning around the corner which offers wash&fold service at $1.4/lb. Shirt wash is only at $2/shirt. neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is the most picturesque area in Boston. It's a safe neighborhood (John Kerry lives here!) with many good restaurants and cafes around. Seven minutes walk and you'll hit Charles River where you can have a morning run or walk around to enjoy the city. Easy access to all the main tourist sites, schools, and office buildings.
notes: The stairs are narrow. Although it hasn't been a problem for me to move my luggage up (and I am small), it can be difficult for some people. The entrance is on a side alley. After you book the room, I'll share a video that guides you to find the house.

name: Comfy 1 BR in Premier Beacon Hill
summary: Perfectly situated off of Charles Street in the upscale neighborhood of Beacon Hill, this charming one bedroom apartment is perfect for couples, small families, and solo business travelers. Simple and modern, this apartment in it's amazing location will make for a wonderful Boston getaway.
space: After wandering the picturesque streets of Beacon Hill, enter your humble abode to find beautiful exposed brick, modern decor, and a place to call home during your stay. The living room boasts a comfortable sofa, flat screen smart TV, and seating by the window to gaze out and people watch. In the kitchen, basic cookware will be provided to whip up a home cooked meal and a Keurig coffee machine along side a variety of coffee pods. We wouldn't want the afternoon slump to get in the way of your travels so please help yourself to all the coffee your heart desires. Next, we have the bedroom which also displays classic exposed brick giving you true Boston ambiance. The bedroom has a queen size bed that can comfortably sleep two people. We are also happy to provide an air mattress upon request. Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided. We are here to provide you with the comfort of a home and confidence of a hotel.

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is regarded as the most desirable, exclusive, and elite neighborhood in Boston. Famous for it's brick red sidewalks and stone streets, it's level of charm is second to none. Home to John Kerry, Uma Thurman, Gisele Bundchen (and Tom Brady), you will truly be living life along side the rich and famous. Take a short stroll to the Boston Common and enjoy a picnic in the park or walk over to the Charles River to watch the boats go by. Beacon Hill is walking distance to so much that Boston has to offer!
notes: Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments! Feel free to check out our other listings on our Airbnb profile.
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just five hours? Want to give your feet a rest? Take the "T" or download the Lyft app. Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

host_about: Greetings! My name is Jen and I'd love to welcome you to my home. I've been an AirBnB host for over a year now, and I just absolutely love it. The difference between a good and great trip is the comfort of your home and I always aim to bring you the best guest experience possible!

name: Beacon Hill - Stay like a local
summary: If you are visiting Boston and want to be able to walk around and enjoy the city for all it offers, you cannot stay in a better location.
space: Queen size bed, fluffy clean bedding, 12 foot ceilings, decorative fireplace, stainless appliances, coffee machine, hot pot, microwave, slow cooker, blender. Full bath and plenty of towels. Bose speaker. Alexa. Large flatscreen TV with Netflix and other viewing options. You will have access to a closet and full dresser. The building is less tidy than the apartment. It desperately needs a paint job. Unfortunately I cannot control that. Otherwise, there is plenty of heat when you need it and hot water!

Queen size bed, fluffy clean bedding, 12 foot ceilings, decorative fireplace, stainless appliances, coffee machine, hot pot, microwave, slow cooker, blender. Full bath and plenty of towels. It desperately needs a paint job. Unfortunately I cannot control that. Otherwise, there is plenty of heat when you need it and hot water! Also, there is laundry in the building next for your use. Coin Op. I will send you the keys. If there is an issue with delivery, I can easily meet you. I am available by text and Airbnb messages to help should you have any questions during your stay. Beacon Hill is the best location in Boston. You can walk everywhere. If you are booking for the marathon,
neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is the best location in Boston. You can walk everywhere. If you are booking for the marathon, its a 15 minute walk to the finish line, one block from the Boston Common, 5-7 minutes to transportation (MBTA). Beacon Hill has numerous quaint restaurants. Stay like a local!
notes: I have a dog. The dog will not be in the apartment but needless to say, if you have an allergy, probably best not book with me. Also, the building is old. If you are anticipating a modern stay, this is not a place for you. I've recently painted the walls, the windows and moulding look like they've been painted a million times. Its charming if you enjoy the antiquities of old architecture.
transit: Walk! or walk to the train. Like I said, best location in Boston.
access: Also, there is laundry in the building next for your use. Coin Op.
interaction: I will send you the keys. If there is an issue with delivery, I can easily meet you. I am available by text and Airbnb messages to help should you have any questions during your stay.

Hi,

I'm from St Louis, MO but have been living in Boston for ten years now.  I travel a lot and I appreciate others that share the desire to explore.  I like to think I'm still young, working professional.  I like local restaurants, dive bars and the ocean.  I'm hugely respectful and grateful of others and I hope for the same in return. Happy Travels!

name: Charming 1 BR | 1 BA Apt Beacon Hill-Boston
summary: A charming newly renovated entire apartment located 3rd floor in Beacon Hill one of Boston's most historic neighborhoods.  Short walking distance:  Boston Common, Public Garden, State House, Charles River, Center City, and MGH. Closet stores-restaurants: Whole Foods Market, Starbucks, Au Bon Pain, Allegro Coffee, Anna's Taqueria, Fin's Sushi+Grill, All Star Pizza Bar, Hubway (Boston's bike share).   Step to train lines (Green Line-Park St, Red Line-Charles/MGH).  You are in the center of Boston.
space: Entire Apartment for 3 guests located on the 3rd floor walks up with a view from the window, AC unit in summer, one sleeper sofa and one queen size bed with a firm mattress.  Full bathroom with a shower and a tub, a refrigerator, a dishwasher, an oven, a stove, 40" HDTV (Netflix only), a table for three.   Paid parking garage and street meters (Parking App SpotHero, BestParking are helpful).  Noted that the apartment is above a restaurant/ac units and has some noise (complaints must be given within 6 hours of check-in).

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill one of Boston's most picturesque areas, tony Beacon Hill has steep streets lined with Federal-style and Victorian brick row houses lit by antique lanterns.  The gold-domed Massachusetts State House overlooks Boston Common, with its winter skating pond.  Across Charles Street home to chic boutiques and antique shops, in the formal Public Garden.  The Charles River Esplanade's Hatch Shell hosts summer concerts.
notes: Trash schedule is picked up on Monday and Friday morning.  Trash can only be place on the sidewalk after 5:00pm on the day before pick up or contact me if the trash needs to be removed during your stay.  Please be mindful to our neighbors and quiet after 10pm.  THERE WILL BE A $100 FINE IF KEYS ARE LOST.
transit: I highly recommend relying on public transportation (MBTA) to get to places. Some stations on the MBTA are Park, Haymarket, Charles/MGH, and Gov't Center. T stops are all within walking distance which allows easy access to Logan International Airport and the rest of the Greater Boston Area.  Also, recommend Uber/Lyft.   Apps:  BostonMap, ParkBoston, MBTA or Moovit to get detailed step by step direction.  View detailed routes on a map, see bus and train schedules, arrival times.
access: Self-check-in: Two keys inside the Master Lockbox (left side of the front door)  Self check-out:  Please put keys back in the Master Lockbox (host take care the trash)
interaction: I want the guest to enjoy their privacy, but I am available when needed, I am accessible.  No matter how long, or short the guest stays, I will send a text message, just check to make sure guest are comfortable and everything is meeting expectations.  If they need anything to make their stay more pleasant, I am available.
house_rules: No packages may be sent to the building without host approval. No additional guest without host approval. No outside visitors without host approval. No candles.  Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property LOCALS GUEST MUST COMMUNICATE WITH HOST BEFORE BOOKING CLEAN THE KITCHEN AFTER YOU USE IT LEAVE THE APARTMENT AS YOU FOUND IT LATE FEE $15 PER HALF HOUR FOR UNRETURNED KEYS AFTER CHECKOUT TIME BREAK OR DAMAGE SOMETHING, PLEASE ARRANGE FOR ITS REPLACEMENT OR REPAIR

name: Unique & Charming Pocket of Beacon Hill
summary: Unique, charming Beacon Hill condo with private entrance and patio! Offering private bedroom with office nook, shared bathroom, washer/dryer, full kitchen and living room. Condo has lots of natural light. Take a seat in the shady patio garden and relax like a local! Centrally located: 5-15 minute walks to all subway lines, or walk down the hill for Charles Street shops, Charles River/Esplanade or Public Garden/Boston Common. Owner occupied, cat in home, stairs w/ no ramp. No smoking, no pets.
space: NA
description: Unique, charming Beacon Hill condo with private entrance and patio! Offering private bedroom with office nook, shared bathroom, washer/dryer, full kitchen and living room. Condo has lots of natural light. Take a seat in the shady patio garden and relax like a local! Centrally located: 5-15 minute walks to all subway lines, or walk down the hill for Charles Street shops, Charles River/Esplanade or Public Garden/Boston Common. Owner occupied, cat in home, stairs w/ no ramp. No smoking, no pets. Access to full kitchen (vegetarian cooking only), living room and condo's private patio. Owner's downstairs bedroom is off-limits. Guests are welcome to coffee/tea/breakfast items. I live in this 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo and will be on-site (or easily reached) throughout your stay. The Beacon Hill neighborhood is a registered National Historic Site and includes the State House, multiple house museums and the Museum of African American History. It is walking distance to the Boston Common (where
neighborhood_overview: The Beacon Hill neighborhood is a registered National Historic Site and includes the State House, multiple house museums and the Museum of African American History. It is walking distance to the Boston Common (where the Freedom Trail begins), the Public Garden (America's oldest) and the Esplanade green space along the Charles River. Two of Boston's best shopping streets, Charles Street and Newbury Street, are also walking distance.
notes: I rescued my cat Josephina from a shelter nearly six years ago. Due to a history of abuse she does not trust strangers, so please do not try to pet her or follow her around, and please keep the front door closed at all times so she doesn't get out and become disoriented/lost. If you don't think you can resist trying to touch her (I understand it can be hard!), this may not be the right space for you, but previous visitors have said they found enjoyment simply watching her nap, play on her cat tree, or people-watch from the window sills.
transit: Parking is difficult in Beacon Hill, so if you come with a car you will need to store it in a parking garage or risk an expensive towing experience. The closest parking garages are on Charles Street and Cambridge Street, but the best deal is the Boston Common parking garage, a 15-20 minute walk from my condo. I don't have a car and get around on foot or via public transportation: every subway line and many bus routes are a 5-15 walk away.
access: Access to full kitchen (vegetarian cooking only), living room and condo's private patio. Owner's downstairs bedroom is off-limits. Guests are welcome to coffee/tea/breakfast items.
interaction: I live in this 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo and will be on-site (or easily reached) throughout your stay.
house_rules: At least one guest must be female.

We would love to have you stay at our place!

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill, one of the oldest and most picturesque neighborhoods in the United States, is a thriving residential community and a popular tourist destination, located just a short walk from Boston's theater district. This charming historic region, with its Federal, Greek Revival, and Victorian architecture is known for its historical landmarks, and its many antique shops, boutiques, and fine eating and drinking establishments. The area, approximately one-half to three quarters of a mile square, is bounded by Cambridge Street on the north, Somerset Street on the east, Beacon Street on the south, and Storrow Drive on the west. The Massachusetts State House, with its magnificent gilded dome, is a prominent landmark on Beacon Street just across from the Boston Common, a popular park enjoyed by residents and tourists alike. Walk Score: 98 out of 100 "A Walkers Paradise" Transit Score: 100 The apartment is cozy, warm, quiet, and quiet. You'll have the entire space all to yourself. Classicall
notes: The kitchen includes refrigerator with freezer, stove, oven, microwave, coffee maker, plates, utensils, glasses, cookware, coffee, spices, etc.  Brand new everything - beautifully high end.  The whole unit professionally designed. The beds include high end Brooklinen Sheeting, 100% cotton, all towels and soaps are provided and are all natural.  There is laundry in the apartment with washer and dryer if you need it as well as laundry soap. There are two close parking garages - each a 4 minute walk - one on Charles Street and one on the Boston Common. We will provide you with restaurant recommendations, but if you need any additional  recommendations just ask and we'll find the right venue for you! For visiting museums: buy tickets online and avoid the lines :)
transit: Most tourists do almost everything on foot.  This location has a walker score of 98 - "A walkers paradise".  There are two train lines that are a 5 minute walk - the Green T line and Red T line.  They will get you everywhere else you might like to go.  There are also taxis everywhere.  Just step out and hail one on Charles Street.  For those driving, there are two parking garages close by - one on Charles Street (2 minute walk) and  one on the Common (3 minute walk). neighborhood_overview: Arguably the best neighborhood in all of Boston.  As a little neighborhood with big history, Beacon Hill overlooks the nation’s first public park and the Massachusetts State House. Many of the city’s high-profile public figures call Beacon Hill home, and rubbing elbows with your congressman in the neighborhood’s boutique grocer checkout line is commonplace. Combine its stately black-shuttered brownstones and old-world cobblestone streets with its contemporary amenities and central location, and it’s easy to understand why Beacon Hill boasts such a prestigious reputation. Walk Score: 98 "Walkers Paradise" Transit Score: 100 The apartment is cozy, warm, quiet, and quiet. You'll have the entire space all to yourself. Classically Bostonian, the building was built a little over 100 years ago and still maintains its historic facade. Brand new kitchen counter tops, tiles, dark hardwood floors, custom cabinetry, and wood finishes throughout the apartment. Conveniently located near: 3 minute wa
notes: Let me be your concierge!  I am happy to help with recommendations, reservations, whatever you need :)

Steps from a bevy of top restaurants and shopping.  Couldn't be a better location for walking or takting the Red Line or Green Line for a short train ride anywhere in Boston.  Mass General Hospital a 10 minute walk.  2 minutes from Charles St and the public garden.

summary: EXPERIENCE BOSTON TO THE FULLEST! What makes this house unbeatable are the central location, the quiet at night, the history, and picturesque neighbourhood. My place will provide you with the best experience of exploring Boston as the locals. This is a great choice for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and families (with kids over 9 years old).
space: Located on the 2nd floor of a historic brownstone (built in 1910) in Beacon Hill – one of the oldest and most picturesque neighborhoods in Boston or the U.S, my place will provide you the best experience of exploring Boston as the locals. My place is ONLY 2 minute walk to the famous Charles street, 3 minute walk to Charles/MGH station (Red line) or MGH hospital, 3 minute to the Charles River Esplanade, 5 minute walk to the Boston Public Garden/Boston Common, 7 minute walk to Backbay and short walk to the Financial District.  --- Please note there is NO ELEVATOR, so it is two flights of stairs up from street level. My place is not suitable for guests that have many large, and heavy luggage.  --- YOUR BEDROOM has a queen bed and very comfortable queen mattress. The room has 2 big windows and charming woods shades that are adjustable. host_about:
Immediately after I started my fellowship here at Harvard, I  felt in love with Boston. I  love the history, the richness in cultures and the variety of activities to do and  Boston has many good restaurants.
I love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with my friends around the city.  I love travelling, making friends and experiencing new places.  I have also just returned from a big trip visiting friends in Portland, San Francisco, Denver, and New York - it was amazing.
 
 I work in the medical diagnostic field. I run events for non-profit biotech organizations in town and write about ways to improve higher educations and training.
I would love to have you stay at my place and share my Boston experience!

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill, one of the oldest and most picturesque neighborhoods in the United States, is a thriving residential community and a popular tourist destination, located just a short walk from Boston's theater district. This charming historic region, with its Federal, Greek Revival, and Victorian architecture is known for its historical landmarks, and its many antique shops, boutiques, and fine eating and drinking establishments. The area, approximately one-half to three quarters of a mile square, is bounded by Cambridge Street on the north, Somerset Street on the east, Beacon Street on the south, and Storrow Drive on the west. The Massachusetts State House, with its magnificent gilded dome, is a prominent landmark on Beacon Street just across from the Boston Common, a popular park enjoyed by residents and tourists alike. Walk Score: 98 out of 100 "A Walkers Paradise" Transit Score: 100 The apartment is cozy, warm, quiet, and quiet. You'll have the entire space all to yourself. Classicall
notes: The kitchen includes refrigerator with freezer, stove, oven, microwave, coffee maker, plates, utensils, glasses, cookware, coffee, spices, etc.  Brand new everything - beautifully high end.  The whole unit professionally designed. The beds include high end Brooklinen Sheeting, 100% cotton, all towels and soaps are provided and are all natural.  There is laundry in the apartment with washer and dryer if you need it as well as laundry soap. There are two close parking garages - each a 4 minute walk - one on Charles Street and one on the Boston Common. We will provide you with restaurant recommendations, but if you need any additional  recommendations just ask and we'll find the right venue for you! For visiting museums: buy tickets online and avoid the lines :)
transit: Most tourists do almost everything on foot.  This location has a walker score of 98 - "A walkers paradise".  There are two train lines that are a 5 minute walk - the Green T line and Red T line.  They will get you everywhere else you might like to go.  There are also taxis everywhere.  Just step out and hail one on Charles Street.  For those driving, there are two parking garages close by - one on Charles Street (2 minute walk) and  one on the Common (3 minute walk). Conveniently located near: 3 minutes to Boston Common Park 3 minute walk to Starbucks 1 minute away from restaurants and takeout places 5 minute walk to Green/Orange/Red lines 10 minute walk to Whole Foods 10 minute to start of Freedom Trail 10 minutes to downtown Boston 5 minutes to the Old State House (with a yummy steak house inside) 10 minute walk to Quincy Market 15 minute walk to the aquarium 15 minute walk to the North End and Little Italy (or 5 minutes by subway) 10 minute walk to Charles River 15 minute subway rid
access: Everything, the apartment is yours! The entire apartment, and everything that Boston has to offer within walking distance.
interaction: I am available as needed, happy to help with anything :)   I would love to be your concierge.

NO SMOKING on Street, must walk to Charles - No guests under 25 without parents
host_about: World traveler and dog lover!  I love to travel and love to provide great authentic spaces to say in for fellow travelers.  I am an animal lover and pups are most welcome in my spaces!  I am a foodie, rider, skier and all around high energy curious person.  I love learning about new places, having new experiences, and being thrown into an exciting journey.

name: Cozy Beacon Hill Apartment
summary: Our cozy apartment is located on one of the most iconic & picturesque streets in Beacon Hill, Boston. It offers an eclectic mix of boutiques, shops, restaurants, bakeries and bars. The beautiful Charles River Esplanade, Boston Common, Downtown Crossing, Newbury Street & the North End are all located within a 5-15 minute walk. The Charles/MGH Red Line station is a 7-minute walk and the Arlington St Green Line station is a 9-minute walk (through the Boston Public Gardens).
space: Our comfy second floor, 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment is located in a charming and quaint brick row building in one of the best neighborhoods in Boston. It is the perfect place for family, friends, couples, professionals and groups up to 3 people. The bedroom has two large windows that bring in lots of natural sunlight. We have a comfy queen size bed with fresh linens and comfy blankets, and a large closet. There is also a desk which makes it the perfect area for work or study. There is a small sitting area with a couch and 43" HD TV with full cable and also Netflix and Showtime. The couch folds down into a bed and we provide the linens for that if it is needed as a bed. We also have a queen size air mattress if it is needed for additional sleeping arrangements. The kitchen is fully equipped with a refrigerator, stove, microwave, tea kettle, coffee maker, and French press. Coffee, creamers, sugar and an array of delicious teas are always provided! neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill overlooks the nation’s first public park and the Massachusetts State House. Brick row houses feature ornate doors and decorative iron work. Its narrow streets are lined with brick sidewalks and gas lamps. Many of the city’s high-profile public figures call Beacon Hill home, and is an area known for tourism.
notes: ***We are located on a busy, lively street in Beacon Hill. It can be noisy at times due to the awesome shops, restaurants and famous tourist attractions.**** Unfortunately, our street and most of the surrounding streets are resident parking only and meter parking. There are multiple parking garages located in the area. Prices vary depending on the day of the week, events, times etc. You can view their websites for more information on pricing. *Boston Common Garage - Zero Charles St, Boston— .03 miles *Charles St Garage - 144 Charles St, Boston— .06 miles
transit: With a walk score of 98 and a transit score of 100, our neighborhood is considered a walkers and riders paradise! Another excellent way to explore the city is with the Hubway Bike Share Program. The Hubway Bike has stations throughout the Boston area. The closest station to our apartment is only 600 feet away at Beacon St and Charles St Station. Other stations are located throughout the city. Locations can be downloaded to your smart-phone. Join online and enjoy the city by bicycle! It's a great way to get around the city! Below is a list of the closest Subway stations, tourist attractions, points of interest, universities, and much more....... Closet Subway Stations: Park St. Station – Red and Green Line Subway – 0.4 miles Charles/Mass General Hospital Station – Red Line Subway – 0.3 miles North Station – Orange Line Subway, Green Line Subway, and Purple Line Subway and Amtrak – 1 mile – can also access here from Park Station Green Line Subway Bowdoin Station – Blue Line Subway – 0.6
access: During your stay, this is your home away from home! You will have access to: the entire apartment.
interaction: We live close by and are available by Airbnb message, text or phone. You can contact us if you have questions.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking allowed in the apartment or the building. $100 will be deducted from the security fee for smoking inside the unit or building.
host_about:
We love to meet people from all over the world. Traveling is a passion of ours and we enjoy visiting different countries and learning about their culture.
We are serious animal lovers and have 5 rescue animals. Eventually, we would love to have a farm and rescue animals. :)

name: (R1-22) Cozy Beacon Hill Studio
summary: "One of Boston’s most picturesque areas, tony Beacon Hill has steep streets lined with Federal-style and Victorian brick row houses lit by antique lanterns. The gold-domed Massachusetts State House overlooks Boston Common, with its winter skating pond. Across Charles Street, home to chic boutiques and antiques shops, is the formal Public Garden. The Charles River Esplanade’s Hatch Shell hosts summer concerts."
space: Cozy, simple, no thrills (other than location location location,) apartment. This studio apartment includes ones comfortable queen bed with fluffy white linens, a small couch, and high-speed wifi. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything to cook simple meals, included coffee maker, blender, microwave, pots/pans and toaster etc... Location is unbeatable, walking distance to the T, the Boston Commons, restaurants, city tours, night life, hospitals, Whole Foods and more! More units available!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Beacon Hill, one of Boston’s most picturesque spots. The streets are lined with Federal-style houses and antique lanterns. Famously, it is the sight of the nation’s first public park and the impressive Massachusetts State House. The neighborhood’s prestigious reputation is well-deserved, as it is both historic and contemporary at the same time. The term ‘Beacon Hill’ is often used to refer to the state government or the legislature. Residents can take a stroll over to the nearby Boston Common. Jet-setting is easy since Logan International Airport is just 20 minutes away on the T, or 10 minutes away by car.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

name: Gorgeous Bay Window Charles Street Studio!
summary: The best neighborhood in Boston! This quaint little neighborhood has all you can ask for, from Starbucks and Whole Foods to the antique shops, boutiques, restaurants and bars. Beautiful green space and the Charles River, to the brownstones and cobblestone streets, this is where you want to stay should you make a trip to Boston.
space: A beautiful, traditional-style Beacon Hill studio. Get the true city experience with this CANNOT beat location-- set right on Charles Street. 2 sets of bay windows overlook Charles so you won't miss any action and you can scope out the line at Tatte before you get your coffee and pastries! Features include a full bed, bay window cushioned bench seating, dining table and a 70' plasma TV mounted over a fireplace.

name: Boston's Beacon Hill ✔ Location ✔✔✔ Book Now!
summary: Our one bedroom apartment is located in the historic Beacon Hill neighborhood of Boston, is blocks from Mass General Hospital, TD Garden, and Mass State House (which also happens to be the start of the Freedom Trail!) You'll love the location. Steps to numerous restaurants, historic architecture, and multiple public transportation options. Please note: fourth floor apartment with NO elevator!
space: Luxuriously and expertly furnished one bedroom apartment in historic Beacon Hill.  There is an open kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite counter top. Our living room has a TV with Roku and high speed internet for streaming, and a couch that pulls out to become a full size bed. The bedroom has plenty of light and offers a queen size bed. A short 20 minute walk or ride to The Boston Marathon Finish Line
description: Our one bedroom apartment is located in the historic Beacon Hill neighborhood of Boston, is blocks from Mass General Hospital, TD Garden, and Mass State House (which also happens to be the start of the Freedom Trail!) You'll love the location. Steps to numerous restaurants, historic architecture, and multiple public transportation options. Please note: fourth floor apartment with NO elevator! Luxuriously and expertly furnished one bedroom apartment in historic Beacon Hill.  There is an open kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite counter top. Our living room has a TV with Roku and high speed internet for streaming, and a couch that pulls out to become a full size bed. The bedroom has plenty of light and offers a queen size bed. A short 20 minute walk or ride to The Boston Marathon Finish Line You'll have full access to the apartment, which is stocked with essential toiletries, high quality hotel towels and linens. An iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available fo
neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is centrally located to everything you can see in Boston both by foot or by public transit(the T).  More information We are steps from historic Charles St which is lined with cute shops, antique stores, and fine restaurants.  What else is wicked close? -Mass General Hospital & Mass Eye and Ear: 6 minute walk -Charles MGH Red Line Stop: 4 minute walk TD Garden: 14 minute walk Massachusetts State House: 9 minute walk Boston Common: 11 minute walk  North End: 20 minute walk Harvard Square: 14 minutes on the red line MIT: 11 minutes on the red line Easy T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify to complete. We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 3PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination! A quick note about taxes. Beginning July 1st 2019, the city of Boston will collect city and state taxes on short term rentals. We don't have the exact rate yet but it will likely be about 15% to 17.45% of your total. We'll send you a payment request for collection of these taxes nearer to your arrival date. If you'd like more infor
transit: The best of Boston is accessible by foot from our central location, however, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We can give you directions to rent a bike, send a promo code with enough time for discount car sharing programs, and Uber/Lyft is cheap and reliable in town!
access: You'll have full access to the apartment, which is stocked with essential toiletries, high quality hotel towels and linens. An iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for use.
interaction: We are available 24/7 through the Airbnb app and by telephone for emergencies. We are great at giving local directions and suggestions on things to do in the area.
house_rules: -Leave the apartment as you found it.  -Quiet time starts at 9pm. -No shoes allowed in the apartment.  -Please respect us and our neighbors by not having any additional guests.  -No parties. -Smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside.  -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the house without host approval.

name: Spacious & Cozy Apartment in the Heart of Boston
summary: Welcome to Downtown Boston! Life is busy here, lots is happening and you are in the middle of the crossroads of historical places, the best restaurants, the shopping, old Beacon Hill, beautiful Back Bay, residential and cozy South End, the Italian North End, and the modern Seaport! All of the best things to see and do are within minutes walking from your cozy temporary home in Boston.
space: This is a spacious one bedroom apartment right in the center of Boston. The bedroom has a full size bed, and the living room has two sleeping spaces: a twin size pull out sofa and a couch that transforms into a slightly smaller than a full size bed. So the whole place sleeps 4 people, but you could fit 5 if really needed. 2 would have to share a bed.

Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: (4G-3) Beautiful Beacon Hill, Walk to everything!
summary: Welcome to historic Beacon Hill, home of cute cobblestone streets, families, young professionals, and conveniently located in the heart of Boston! This beautifully updated two bedroom apartment is located in the center of Beacon Hill, and is steps from MGH, Boston Commons, Financial Dist, Back Bay and more. Whether you're new to Boston, or a longtime resident, this secluded residence is the first step in contributing to your memorable stay!
space: *No elevator* *3rd floor, stairs only* This apartment has two bedrooms, both with comfortable queen beds and fresh linens! It also includes highspeed internet and a sleeper couch that is perfect for guests staying with kids. For those looking to dine at home, the kitchen is fully equipped for cooking and eating! **Please note the host reserves the right to ask for a photo ID before sending check-in instructions. No refund for lack of identification**

Home Sweet Home, professionally managed!

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill, one of the oldest and most picturesque neighborhoods in the United States, is a thriving residential community and a popular tourist destination, located just a short walk from Boston's theater district. This charming historic region, with its Federal, Greek Revival, and Victorian architecture is known for its historical landmarks, and its many antique shops, boutiques, and fine eating and drinking establishments. The area, approximately one-half to three quarters of a mile square, is bounded by Cambridge Street on the north, Somerset Street on the east, Beacon Street on the south, and Storrow Drive on the west. The Massachusetts State House, with its magnificent gilded dome, is a prominent landmark on Beacon Street just across from the Boston Common, a popular park enjoyed by residents and tourists alike. Walk Score: 98 out of 100 "A Walkers Paradise" Transit Score: 100 The apartment is cozy, warm, quiet, and quiet. You'll have the entire space all to yourself. Classicall
notes: The kitchen includes refrigerator with freezer, stove, oven, microwave, coffee maker, plates, utensils, glasses, cookware, coffee, spices, etc.  Brand new everything - beautifully high end.  The whole unit professionally designed. The beds include high end Brooklinen Sheeting, 100% cotton, all towels and soaps are provided and are all natural.  There is laundry in the apartment with washer and dryer if you need it as well as laundry soap. There are two close parking garages - each a 4 minute walk - one on Charles Street and one on the Boston Common. We will provide you with restaurant recommendations, but if you need any additional  recommendations just ask and we'll find the right venue for you! For visiting museums: buy tickets online and avoid the lines :)
transit: Most tourists do almost everything on foot.  This location has a walker score of 98 - "A walkers paradise".  There are two train lines that are a 5 minute walk - the Green T line and Red T line.  They will get you everywhere else you might like to go.  There are also taxis everywhere.  Just step out and hail one on Charles Street.  For those driving, there are two parking garages close by - one on Charles Street (2 minute walk) and  one on the Common (3 minute walk). Conveniently located near: 3 minutes to Boston Common Park 3 minute walk to Starbucks 1 minute away from restaurants and takeout places 5 minute walk to Green/Orange/Red lines 10 minute walk to Whole Foods 10 minute to start of Freedom Trail 10 minutes to downtown Boston 5 minutes to the Old State House (with a yummy steak house inside) 10 minute walk to Quincy Market 15 minute walk to the aquarium 15 minute walk to the North End and Little Italy (or 5 minutes by subway) 10 minute walk to Charles River 15 minute subway rid
access: Everything in the apartment is yours and everything Boston has to offer is at your feet!
interaction: Available as desired, happy to share Boston tidbits and recommendations.  I know the city well and would love to help you navigate!

neighborhood_overview: Arguably the best neighborhood in all of Boston.  As a little neighborhood with big history, Beacon Hill overlooks the nation’s first public park and the Massachusetts State House. Many of the city’s high-profile public figures call Beacon Hill home, and rubbing elbows with your congressman in the neighborhood’s boutique grocer checkout line is commonplace. Combine its stately black-shuttered brownstones and old-world cobblestone streets with its contemporary amenities and central location, and it’s easy to understand why Beacon Hill boasts such a prestigious reputation. Walk Score: 98 "Walkers Paradise" Transit Score: 100 The apartment is cozy, warm, quiet, and quiet. You'll have the entire space all to yourself. Classically Bostonian, the building was built a little over 100 years ago and still maintains its historic facade. Brand new kitchen counter tops, tiles, dark hardwood floors, custom cabinetry, and wood finishes throughout the apartment. Conveniently located near: 3 minute wa

The whole unit professionally designed. The King bed includes high end Brooklinen Sheeting, 100% cotton, all towels and soaps are provided and are all natural.   There are two close parking garages - each a 4 minute walk - one on Charles Street and one on the Boston Common. We will provide you with restaurant recommendations, but if you need any additional  recommendations just ask and we'll find the right venue for you! For visiting museums: buy tickets online and avoid the lines :)
transit: Steps from the T, steps from many top tourist sites including MIT, The Freedom Trail, Back Bay, Charles Street, Faneuil Hall, TD Garden and many other spots.  Steps from a bevy of top restaurants and shopping.  Couldn't be a better location for walking or takting the Red Line or Green Line for a short train ride anywhere in Boston.  Mass General Hospital a 10 minute walk.  2 minutes from Charles St and the public garden.

name: Perfect Marathon Weekend Getaway
summary: Our Beacon Hill home is your perfect home base for your marathon weekend stay. You will be walking distance to everything Boston has to offer. We are steps to the North End, Boston Common, Freedom Trail and right between the Red and Green Line.
space: The home was recently renovated with high end finishings, with original features like exposed brick walls.  If you love to cook, we have every kitchen gadget imaginable and are across the street from Whole Foods.
description: Our Beacon Hill home is your perfect home base for your marathon weekend stay. You will be walking distance to everything Boston has to offer. We are steps to the North End, Boston Common, Freedom Trail and right between the Red and Green Line. The home was recently renovated with high end finishings, with original features like exposed brick walls.  If you love to cook, we have every kitchen gadget imaginable and are across the street from Whole Foods. We will be staying a few hours away, but will assist with check in and be available by phone and text. We live right in the middle of Beacon Hill, one of the most historic and prettiest neighborhoods in downtown Boston. While you are able to walk to most major attractions from our home, you also have access to the Red and Green line within a 5 min walk.

name: Beautiful Beacon Hill Home - Amazing Location!
summary: Enjoy all that Boston has to offer in this two bedroom condo plus sleeping alcove in Boston's picturesque colonial neighborhood, Beacon Hill. Great place to base your Boston adventure whether it be for work, pleasure or both!
space: The unit is equipped with two queen size beds and one full size bed in the smaller bedroom that can comfortably accommodate two people, a large sofa, and an Ultra HD smart TV with basic cable for your entertainment. This apartment is the ideal place to come home to after a long day of exploring Boston. Cozy and efficient, the kitchen will be stocked with basic cookware for when you are tired of dining out. You will also find a Keurig coffee machine and a variety of complimentary coffee pods. Please note the third bedroom is an alcove off of the main bedroom without a door separating the bedrooms.  Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided.

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is regarded as one of the most desirable neighborhoods in the country. Famous for it's brick sidewalks and stone streets, it's level of charm is second to none. Venture off on a short walk to the Boston Common and enjoy a picnic in the park or walk over to the Charles River to watch the boats go by or join the runners on the beautiful path along the water. Beacon Hill is walking distance to everything that Boston has to offer including the incredible Italian restaurants in the North End, shopping in Back Bay, Mass General Hospital, the MBTA, and so much more!

name: Charming & Beautiful Beacon Hill Two-Bed Apartment
summary: Quaint and charming oasis in Boston in the desirable and historical Beacon Hill neighborhood. This cozy apartment is newly renovated with stainless steel appliances, lots of natural light, and hardwood floors. The apartment can fit four people and is close to delicious restaurants, bars, shopping on Charles and Newbury Streets, and the Boston Commons and Public Gardens. It's also right by the famous Charles River, which is an ideal place to walk or run.  This two-bed is a home away from home!
space: This two-bedroom apartment is fully furnished and has a family/living room, a kitchen table with chairs, extra space for an air mattress (if you have an extra guest), and a great comfortable couch and accent chairs for relaxing. The apartment is fully equipped and comes with a TV, desk (with an extra monitor), WiFi, air conditioning, and central heat. You can use all kitchen appliances and condiments to cook a meal so please make yourself at home! The apartment is on the second floor (exactly 15 steps) so you must be able to climb some stairs.

You can use all kitchen appliances and condiments to cook a meal so please make yourself at home! The apartment is on the second floor (exactly 15 s
neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is a charming, quiet, and local neighborhood. It is very centrally located and is close to many tourist attractions while not losing its local and quaint neighborhood feel.  You will close to the Freedom Trail, Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH), Massachusetts State House, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, and the oldest park in the country known as the Boston Common. You will also be within walking distance of Back Bay, the North End, Downtown Crossing, and the Financial District. With small coffee shops, local and boutique shops, and lots of restaurants, Beacon Hill will offer you the best and most historic taste of Boston - and you'll feel like a local while doing so!
notes: NA
transit: The apartment is very close to the Charles River which offers incredible views and has a great running and walking path. The apartment is three blocks away from the Charles Street T Stop with access to the Red Line. There are other nearby T stops so you can access the Orange and Green line quite easily as well. Cambridge can easily be accessed by taking the Red Line at the Charles Street location or walking across the newly and beautifully designed Longfellow Bridge. The apartment is about a 15-minute car ride from the airport. Note that parking is not provided. Parking in the city can be very tough at times so I would suggest that you do your research for garages and parking lots prior to your stay (there are many close by at MGH).
access: You will be able to access the entire apartment and use any/all of the kitchen appliances and condiments to cook a meal. Make yourself at home!
interaction: I am very responsive and will make myself available whenever you need me. If you would like, I have a list of restaurant and activity recommendations and am happy to speak over the phone before your stay for any other questions you might have.
house_rules: Take off shoes outside the apartment if it's raining or snowing No shoes on carpet in the bedrooms No red wine or food on couch Turn off all lights when you leave the apartment Turn off the AC when you leave the apartment

name: (G-3) Beacon Hill Everyone's Favorite
summary: "One of Boston’s most picturesque areas, Beacon Hill has steep streets lined with Federal-style and Victorian brick row houses lit by antique lanterns. The gold-domed Massachusetts State House overlooks Boston Common, with its winter skating pond. Across Charles Street, home to chic boutiques and antiques shops, is the formal Public Garden. The Charles River Esplanade’s Hatch Shell hosts summer concerts."
space: Come enjoy this beautiful 2 bedroom in condo in the heart of Beacon Hill...Boston's most prominent and beautiful neighborhood.  This condo offers two large bedrooms with queen size beds, and dining room.  The living room offers enough space to relax and watch cable TV.  There is an air mattress in the unit.  There is another unit in the same building for larger groups.  Also, coin laundry in basement! This is an older building, third floor walk up!

host_about:
Hi I'm Lucy

I am a ballet/dance instructor. Originally from Tokyo, Japan, lived in Providence, RI for many years. I live in Cotuit with my fiancé , Scott now.
I am friendly and LOVE to host my friends and family so it was almost "meant to be" to sign up with Airbnb to become a host for Scott's lovely flat in Beacon Hill, Boston which he has owned for many years and only uses occasionally. (he teaches graduate students in Cambridge)
I am easy going and friendly.  I want all my guests to have a fantastic, memorable , and headache free (most importantly!) stay in Boston whether you are there with your friends and family or alone for business.

summary: The delightful duplex is located in the middle of Boston in Beacon Hill. It is newly renovated and redecorated.  The Museum of Science is close by, so you can hop on an iconic Duck Boat Tour. The Charles River, which is close, is a great place for walking and seeing the sunset. It is located near stops for the Green and the Red Line of the T. With it's location Boston is at your finger tips. This lovely duplex makes a wonderful home no matter how long the stay!
space: It has two bedrooms (one with a queen bed and one with a full), one bathroom, a kitchen/living room combo, and a shared patio that is great for a dog. Please do not use the fire place

name: Beacon Hill 1BR- Lovely, Cozy, Modern
summary: Lovely, 1 bed located in Boston’s gorgeous historic neighborhood, Beacon Hill. Great for solo travelers, friends or couples. Has a open layout, kitchen with a breakfast bar, several windows and hardwood floors throughout. Few blocks away from beautiful Charles St. and the Esplanade. Conveniently located to many points of interest and close to several T stops. Foodies, and travelers rejoice!  Short walking distance: Boston Common, Public Garden, State House, Charles River, Center City, and MGH.
space: Lovingly decorated and furnished to make you feel at home. Bedroom has a good sized closet and is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. Full bathroom with linens.  KITCHEN: Kitchen is stocked with basic spices, utensils, dish ware, flatware, glasses, pots and pans for your convenience. Whole Foods is across the street so please feel free to buy groceries and whip something up if you desire to do so. There is NO coffee machine in the kitchen, but Starbucks is next door and other awesome coffeeshops are close by as well.  BUILDING: My building is lovely and very quiet. Parties and loud music are NOT ALLOWED as it would disturb my community and neighbors. Having awesome neighbors requires being an awesome neighbor :). Quiet hours begin at 10PM. Walkable is an understatement. Easy access to: Boston Common, Public Garden, State House, Charles River, Center City, and MGH.Closet stores-restaurants: Whole Foods Market, Starbucks, Au Bon Pain, Allegro Coffee, Anna's Taqueria, Fin's Sushi

name: Gorgeous Beacon Hill 1BR | 1BA
summary: Come stay at our lovely condo in the heart of Boston's most desirable neighborhood, Beacon Hill! Our recently renovated 1 BR | 1 BA condo is beautifully furnished and comes with everything you need for an enjoyable stay. Whether you want to walk the Freedom Trail, jump on a Duck Boat Tour, visit a relative at Mass General, shop on Newbury St, or dine on Charles St, you will find it all within walking distance. You could not be more conveniently located to take in all the city has to offer!
space: - This condo is on the second floor of a walk-up brownstone in Boston's historic Beacon Hill, which is one of the oldest and most picturesque neighborhoods in the United States. - The condo boasts a full kitchen, living room (with a full-size pull out sofa bed), queen bedroom, and one bathroom with a shower.  - The living room is equipped with a 55" HDTV with cable and Apple TV.  - The kitchen is of moderate size, and allows for a lot of cooking. It contains a toaster, coffee maker, electric tea kettle, microwave, stove, oven, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, kitchen utensils, and pots & pans.  All of the kitchen supplies are available for your use. - The bed will have fresh sheets and towels will be set-out upon your arrival. Additional sheets, comforter, and pillows for the sofa bed will be provided in the closet. Please bring your own toiletries. THE LOCATION - It can’t be beat in Boston!  The condo is located just steps from the Boston Public Garden, Boston Common, the Charles River, t

It contains a toaster, coffee maker, electric tea kett
neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: - Please make sure you read the house rules and our entire posting before you inquire and book.   - This is a non-smoking condo and pets are not allowed, sorry.   - The fireplace in the living room is non-functioning and is decoration only, as it is completely boarded up. - Please contact me and share a little bit about yourself when booking! Thanks!
transit: Public Transit is very close and convenient – Red line (Charles/MGH is 6min walk, Park St 10min), Green line (Arlington 9min, Boylston 9min, Park St 10min). We are only a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport (around $25) or about a 35 minute ride by public transportation ($2.75/person). Street parking in the city is mostly residential with some metered parking. In Beacon Hill there is metered parking on Charles St, Cambridge St, and Beacon St, which run from 8AM-8PM and is free overnight, all-day Sunday, and on holidays. There are also parking garages available. Below is a list of the closet garages to our place in order of distance and their 24 hour parking rates. The top one is the closest to our place, only a 3 minute walk, but all are within a 10 minute walk. The rates are lower for less than 24 hours.  Boston Common Garage: Zero Charles St ($32) Charles Street Parking Garage: 144 Charles St ($42) LAZ Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary: 327 Cambridge St ($35) Standard Charles Rive
access: NA
interaction: I will be available by phone and email during your stay. I also live in another condo in the same building so I'm just a few steps away if you need me.
house_rules: - Absolutely no smoking in the condo. Violators will forfeit their security deposit. - Please take off your shoes when entering the condo - Do NOT use the fireplace in the living room -- it is decoration only and completely boarded up - All trash/recycling must be placed in the trashcans or in trash/recycling bags - Wash all used dishes, close all the widows, and turn off all the lights before you check-out - Be respectful or our neighbors in the building Please have a great time and treat it like you’d treat your own home!
host_about:
Hello!
My husband and I are young professionals living in Beacon Hill in Boston.  Matt is a software engineer at a local Boston company, while I am a dance team coach at a university.  I like watching Patriots games, dancing, and relaxing with a good book.  Matt enjoys cooking, spending time with friends, and running on the Charles River.  We both love to spend our free time traveling and exploring new places.  We also love hosting guests and it would be our pleasure to host you during your travels!

host_about:
Hi I'm Lucy

I am a ballet/dance instructor. Originally from Tokyo, Japan, lived in Providence, RI for many years. I live in Cotuit with my fiancé , Scott now.
I am friendly and LOVE to host my friends and family so it was almost "meant to be" to sign up with Airbnb to become a host for Scott's lovely flat in Beacon Hill, Boston which he has owned for many years and only uses occasionally. (he teaches graduate students in Cambridge)
I am easy going and friendly.  I want all my guests to have a fantastic, memorable , and headache free (most importantly!) stay in Boston whether you are there with your friends and family or alone for business.

summary: Book this place for the best location you can ask for!  The house is a simple, historical 19th century home, situated in Boston's best neighborhood, Beacon Hill. Unbeatable location with easy access to every tourist spot. You will be sharing the house with the host and potentially another guest in a typical Beacon Hill townhouse (with lots of characters). Decent size of space with everything you need for a good sleep. Great for those who are looking for a comfy stay in the heart of the city.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Beacon Hill, one of Boston’s most picturesque spots. The streets are lined with Federal-style houses and antique lanterns. Famously, it is the sight of the nation’s first public park and the impressive Massachusetts State House. The neighborhood’s prestigious reputation is well-deserved, as it is both historic and contemporary at the same time. The term ‘Beacon Hill’ is often used to refer to the state government or the legislature. Residents can take a stroll over to the nearby Boston Common. Jet-setting is easy since Logan International Airport is just 20 minutes away on the T, or 10 minutes away by car.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of two months, to a year or more.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: Sunny, upper floor facing the State House!
summary: Live beside the State House and the Boston Common in a concierge building!  This upper floor, sunny 1 bed features shiny parquet wood floors, queen size bed, flat screen TV in the living room and the bedroom, dining area, couch with foldout bed, walk-in-closet and a view of downtown.  The kitchen features granite counters, cooktop, micro-dishwasher and full size fridge. There is also a common roofdeck with amazing views of downtown, laundry and rubbish room on each floor and a concierge.
space: There is a common roofdeck down hall and up the steps from this unit.  It has fabulous views of downtown and the perfect place to watch the sunset!  No pets, smoking or glass!

neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is a picturesque neighborhood filled with history, cobble stone streets and greenery.  It is conveniently located to transportation, shopping, banking, restaurants, the Financial District, Government Center and the Theater District.
notes: No smoking or pets are permitted in the unit or on the common roofdeck. This listing is subject to Boston Occupancy Taxes.  This collection process should begin July 1st and we are working with Airbnb and the city to finalize the details.
transit: The closest subway is the Red  Park Street stop.  There are also various bus tour companies that stop in front of the State House. This is a great way to get to know the city and learn about all of our history.

host_about: I manage a number of furnished units around Boston and Brookline with my business partner Joseph Morrissey.  I am a Realtor with Unlimited Sotheby's  and do sales/rentals in the greater Boston market.  I also manage a sculpture school/studio with my husband, sculptor Morris Norvin.  Stonybrook Fine Arts, is located in the Boston neighborhood Jamaica Plain across the street from the famous Sam Adams Brewery.  We offer a variety of one day workshops on our calendar including welding, jewelry and metal casting.   Longer classes are available and meet one time each week including the options above as well as mold making, live figure modeling and foundry.  Custom workshops are available for small groups, birthday parties, bachelorette parties, make your own wedding bands, create an engagement ring and team building.  We are happy to arrange a tour of Sam Adams after a daytime workshop not occurring on Sunday.  Contact us for more details to set up your custom event!

name: (M) Private Entrance, Beacon Hill!
summary: "One of Boston’s most picturesque areas, tony Beacon Hill has steep streets lined with Federal-style and Victorian brick row houses lit by antique lanterns. The gold-domed Massachusetts State House overlooks Boston Common, with its winter skating pond. Across Charles Street, home to chic boutiques and antiques shops, is the formal Public Garden. The Charles River Esplanade’s Hatch Shell hosts summer concerts."
space: This perfectly located one bedroom apartment is great for those that like a convenient and easy stay! Directly access to the unit, no common areas shared with the rest of the building, ensures privacy for your stay in Boston. The apartment has one queen bedroom with a desk to work at. The TV is in the bedroom and has high speed wifi to connect with the smart TV, no cable. The living room has kitchen supplied with basic cookware and a fabulous high top table for 4, to eat, work or play games at! The couch turns into a pullout sleeping space for 1 or 2 people! The bathroom is connected to the bedroom, it's small but adequate! The apartment has ac AC unit in the bedroom and livingroom/kitchen area!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Beacon Hill, one of Boston’s most picturesque spots. The streets are lined with Federal-style houses and antique lanterns. Famously, it is the sight of the nation’s first public park and the impressive Massachusetts State House. The neighborhood’s prestigious reputation is well-deserved, as it is both historic and contemporary at the same time. The term ‘Beacon Hill’ is often used to refer to the state government or the legislature. Residents can take a stroll over to the nearby Boston Common. Jet-setting is easy since Logan International Airport is just 20 minutes away on the T, or 10 minutes away by car.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: Homey Private Room | Best Location in Downtown
summary: Whether you are here for business or leisure, this is the location that takes you any place within a short walk or a quick subway/Uber ride.  Typical Beacon Hill house that gives you a homey comfy good night sleep after a long day of sightseeing or business meetings! The house is old (it's Beacon Hill!) but comes with lots of characters! Great for those who travel here for a few days and need to maximize their time in the city in a lovely and safe neighborhood!
space: This is a typical Beacon Hill townhouse with three bedrooms and one shared bathroom on the third and fourth floor. Potentially, you will share the space with two other guests. You will need to climb rather narrow stairs to your room on the third floor (but hey, this is Beacon Hill. Every house comes with narrow stairs!). I never had problems going upstairs with my carryons, but if you travel with large suitcases, it can be challenging for some people.  The room comes with your own window AC and TV. The shared kitchen is right outside the room with easy access to the fridge and filtered water. Please note that the room is only available when I am in another unit or traveling. You will see my personal belongings in the room, but I'll leave enough space for you to store your clothes.  I decorate the room the way I'd like to stay when I travel. Let me know what you need and I'll try my best to accommodate.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Beacon Hill, one of Boston’s most picturesque spots. The streets are lined with Federal-style houses and antique lanterns. Famously, it is the sight of the nation’s first public park and the impressive Massachusetts State House. The neighborhood’s prestigious reputation is well-deserved, as it is both historic and contemporary at the same time. The term ‘Beacon Hill’ is often used to refer to the state government or the legislature. Residents can take a stroll over to the nearby Boston Common. Jet-setting is easy since Logan International Airport is just 20 minutes away on the T, or 10 minutes away by car.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Photos are from a similar property. Our interior decorating team is currently working on the furnishing. The furniture and equipment will look almost identical, but some differences in layout must be expected. - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details

host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.
